intro: Cissus compressiflora, commonly known as the African rock fig, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions. Its stems are woody and can grow along rock faces or trellises. Cissus compressiflora is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to stabilize soil in erosion-prone areas.
